summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC sets forth agreed-upon revisions to the 2019 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract. The agreement establishes a new three-year term from April 1, 2022, to March 31, 2025, and includes key changes such as a 4.88% increase in wages and use fees, clarifications on the use of still photographs and stock footage, amendments to rules for Public Service Announcements, performer rights regarding scripts/storyboards, revised rates for singing contractors, restrictions on the use of 'digital doubles', updates to foreign and theatrical use provisions, and increases/clarifications regarding contributions to Pension and Health Plans.

This agreement extends and modifies the Low Budget Digital Waiver for Commercials made for Traditional Digital. Effective April 1, 2023, the waiver is extended through March 31, 2024. The parties will continue negotiations for further modifications during 2023.

This document outlines the terms and conditions for the SAG-AFTRA Low Budget Digital Waiver (LBDW) for Commercials, effective June 27, 2024, and sunsetting March 31, 2025 (with an extension noted for April 1 - June 26, 2024). It is available to advertiser and advertising agency signatories for commercials made for Traditional Digital use with a maximum production budget of $100,000 per day (excluding certain post-production and use fees). The waiver specifies terms for performer session fees, use fees, edits, P&H contributions, work hours, and notice requirements. Key restrictions include use limited to Traditional Digital, no exclusivity rights, a maximum period of use of 1 year or 13 weeks, and limitations on using the content in other media without additional payment and consent. It also prohibits celebrities, stunts, and hazardous work under this waiver.

This sideletter to the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract grants a waiver on national cable use rates for signatory advertisers and agencies for commercials transmitted on cable systems with 1,000,001 to 2,000,000 subscribers, setting specific reduced rates for different usage periods.

This agreement is a waiver between SAG-AFTRA and a Producer, modifying the terms of the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contracts specifically for political, candidate, and issue spots related to active ballot measures. It establishes specific, reduced rates and usage terms for linear domestic (Wild Spot) and various forms of digital use (candidate/sponsor websites, streaming platforms, traditional digital). The waiver applies for a limited term co-terminus with the Commercials Contracts and includes conditions regarding performer consent and commercial removal after the campaign, while explicitly excluding commercials made for Presidential elections.

agreement_title: 2020 SAG-AFTRA/JPC Commercials Low Budget Digital Waiver
summary: This document is the 2020 SAG-AFTRA/JPC Commercials Low Budget Digital Waiver, which modifies the standard SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract for low-budget commercials produced for the Internet and new media platforms. It applies to productions with a budget threshold of $100,000 per production day and distinguishes between "Connected Shoots" (shot on the same day as a non-waiver production) and "Unconnected Shoots" (digital-only). The waiver outlines specific, often negotiable, terms for performer session fees, use fees, work hours, edits, and other conditions, while maintaining certain standard contract elements like P&H contributions. It prohibits celebrities, stunts, and hazardous work and incorporates other terms from the main contract. The waiver was set to expire on March 31, 2022.

agreement_info: This waiver allows for an additional payment option for the use of diginets under the 2019 Commercials Contract. Effective 1/1/2021 - 12/31/2021* *currently extended
summary: This agreement is an extension of the SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract waiver for the use of commercials on Digital Subchannels ("Diginets"). It amends the payment terms for performers, offering producers the option of a $5,000 upfront payment for unlimited usage or a per-use payment structure for a 13-week cycle. The extension is effective from November 9, 2021, to March 31, 2022.

agreement_info: 2016 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract in electronic format for Internet
summary: The 2016 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract is an agreement between SAG-AFTRA and the ANA-4A's Joint Policy Committee (representing advertisers and agencies). Its primary purpose is to govern the employment and compensation of principal performers and extra performers in commercials, recognizing SAG-AFTRA as their exclusive bargaining agent. The scope includes principal performers engaged in the United States for commercials produced domestically or internationally, with usage fees covering showings in the US, Canada, and Mexico. Coverage for extra performers is limited to specific geographic zones. The contract defines "commercials" and applies to relevant productions, integrations, and edits from April 1, 2016, onwards.

agreement_info: Effective 2021 ongoing
summary: This document, the 2022 Influencer-Produced Sponsored Content Waiver, allows signatory advertising agencies and advertisers to use content self-produced by Influencers for digital distribution (websites, social media, YouTube) under specific terms that deviate from standard SAG-AFTRA collective bargaining agreements, particularly the Commercials Contract. It covers the Influencer's on-camera/voiceover services but excludes content produced by third parties or services covered by other SAG-AFTRA agreements (like TV commercials). Key provisions include a standard allocation for pension & health contributions, requirements for using the content in other media (often requiring additional payment and consent), a maximum digital use period of 1 year, required notice to the Influencer, and prohibitions on stunts/hazardous conditions and certain nudity. The waiver expires on March 31, 2025.

agreement_info: Effective 12/5/2022
summary: This document is a modification agreement between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC, amending the COVID-19 Commercial Production Safety and Testing Protocol Agreement dated 9/1/22. The primary purpose is to modify the trigger for implementing stricter safety protocols, raising the threshold from eight (8) or more to fourteen (14) or more new COVID-19 hospital admissions per 100,000 people over a 7-day interval.

agreement_title: Termination of the COVID-19 Commercial Production Safety and Testing Protocol Agreement
agreement_info: Effective 5/11/2023
summary: This agreement between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC terminates the COVID-19 Commercial Production Safety and Testing Protocol Agreement, effective May 11, 2023, aligning with the end of the federal public health emergency. While the protocols expire, productions already underway by May 11, 2023, may continue existing mandatory vaccination policies in Zone A. Additionally, performers can request COVID antigen testing for close contact or extreme exertion scenes from May 12, 2023, through July 31, 2023. Producers wishing to retain other COVID safety protocols must seek separate agreement with SAG-AFTRA.

agreement_title: Extension to the COVID-19 Commercial Production Safety and Testing	 Protocol Agreement
agreement_info: Effective 12/21/2022
summary: This agreement extends the COVID-19 Commercial Production Safety and Testing Protocol Agreement between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC. The protocols, originally set to expire on December 31, 2022, are now extended until March 31, 2023, continuing measures to protect cast and crew from COVID risk in the workplace.

agreement_title: Amended COVID‐19 Commercial Production Safety and Testing Protocols
agreement_info: Effective 9/1/2022
summary: This agreement, effective September 1, 2022, is a temporary protocol between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC (representing advertising agencies and advertisers) establishing amended safety and testing requirements for commercial productions during the COVID-19 pandemic. It applies to all individuals on set under the SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract. Key provisions include potential mandatory vaccination policies (where legally permissible), pre-employment and ongoing testing requirements (particularly for unvaccinated individuals), and protocols for positive test results. It also defines an "Escalation Trigger" based on local COVID-19 hospital admissions, which determines whether these amended protocols or prior, stricter ones apply, although certain sections like mandatory vaccination and testing compensation apply regardless of the trigger level. The agreement is set to run until December 31, 2022, but can be extended or modified based on changing conditions.

This temporary agreement between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC establishes mandatory COVID-19 safety and testing protocols for all individuals involved in commercial productions covered under the 2019 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract, including requirements for testing, health assessments, and temperature checks.

agreement_title: COVID-19 Protocols for In-Person Commercial Auditions
agreement_info: Effective 9/9/2021
summary: This document, Appendix B to the SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract, outlines recommended COVID-19 protocols for in-person commercial auditions. Its main purpose is to protect the health and safety of SAG-AFTRA members and industry personnel. The scope of the protocols covers key areas including sanitation, social distancing, personal protection (PPE), health checks, specific guidelines for minor performers, and procedures related to mandatory vaccination policies required by producers or audition locations. It emphasizes that these are recommended procedures and not new legal obligations, subject to updates as understanding of COVID-19 evolves.

agreement_title: 2022 Audio Commercials Contract Memorandum of Agreement
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC (JPC) sets forth revisions to the 2019 SAG-AFTRA Audio Commercials Contract, renaming it the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Audio Commercials Contract. The main purpose is to update the contract for a new term (April 1, 2022, to March 31, 2025) and implement key changes including phased wage and use fee increases (totaling 9.76%), revised audition procedures (especially for virtual auditions, prohibiting required equipment and mandating accessible copy), updated rules for theatrical/industrial exhibition compensation, clarification on the maximum period of commercial use (21 months), provisions regarding digital doubles, and adjustments to arbitration claim submission timelines.

agreement_info: This waiver is applicable to dynamic audio commercials only. Dynamic audio advertising utilizes digital technology to create customized, audio-only ads, with elements of a commercial “dynamically” changed at the time of delivery to reflect the listener’s specific circumstances, such as location, weather or time of day.
summary: This Dynamic Audio Waiver establishes specific terms and conditions solely for dynamic audio commercials, which are customized based on listener circumstances, and explicitly excludes standard audio commercials. It details session fees, unlimited digital use fees for various durations, and additional payments for repurposing material or mechanical edits, while also noting applicable contributions and other terms from the main Audio Commercials Contract.

This waiver outlines the specific terms and conditions for performers involved in the creation of dynamic audio commercials that utilize digital voice replicas. It establishes compensation rates for live sessions, the creation of AI-generated commercials and customization elements using the performer's voice replica, and digital-only use fees. The agreement also includes provisions for health and retirement contributions and the protection and security of the digital voice replica, while incorporating other applicable terms from the SAG-AFTRA Audio Commercials Contract. It explicitly states that these terms apply only to dynamic audio commercials using voice replicas and not to standard audio commercials or terrestrial radio use.

This agreement between a Producer and SAG-AFTRA sets the terms and conditions for the recording and use of station operational non-commercial jingles performed by singers. It incorporates the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract but modifies it specifically for these jingles. The jingles covered are for unlimited use only on the stations for which they are recorded and must not contain commercial copy or messages. The agreement applies only to individuals considered "employees" of the Producer and does not cover commercials or other types of content.

agreement_info: 2016 SAG-AFTRA Commercials Contract in electronic format for Internet
summary: This agreement, the 2016 SAG-AFTRA Audio Commercials Contract, is made between SAG-AFTRA and the ANA-4A's Joint Policy Committee (representing advertisers and agencies). Its main purpose is to establish the minimum terms and conditions for the engagement of performers (actors, singers, announcers, sound effects persons) in commercials made for use on the Internet, New Media (digital/electronic platforms), commercial sound recordings, and other audio reproduction means for radio or television broadcasting. The scope includes recognition of SAG-AFTRA as the exclusive bargaining agency, requirements for performer union membership, provisions for dispute resolution via arbitration, and detailed terms regarding payment due dates and handling of overpayments.

agreement_title: 2019 Audio Commercials Contract Memorandum of Agreement
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between SAG-AFTRA and The Joint Policy Committee, LLC updates the 2016 Audio Commercials Contract, implementing changes such as a 6% increase in minimum compensation, revised rules for commercial usage and unauthorized use on digital platforms, new provisions on auditions and non-discrimination, and adjustments to health and retirement fund contributions, effective from April 1, 2019, to March 31, 2022.

agreement_title: 2022 Corporate Educational and Non-Broadcast Contract Ebook
agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This agreement, effective November 1, 2022, is between SAG-AFTRA and Producers, establishing minimum wage scales and working conditions for performers in Corporate/Educational and Non-Broadcast programs. It covers various types of non-broadcast content used for instruction, education, sales, or entertainment at specific locations, defining what constitutes a 'program' and categorizing them into Category I (primarily training/information, often perpetual use) and Category II (primarily sales/promotion, restricted exhibition, 3-year use limit). The agreement explicitly excludes commercials, which are covered by a separate contract, and requires separate negotiation for programs intended for World's Fairs or similar events.

agreement_title: 12/21/22 Extension to the COVID-19 Co/Ed & Non-Broadcast Contract Production Safety & Testing Protocol Agreement
summary: This agreement extends the COVID-19 Production Safety and Testing Protocol Agreement for the Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract until March 31, 2023, continuing the effective safety measures for cast and crew.

agreement_title: Notice of Termination of Co-Ed COVID Protocols 2023
summary: This notice from SAG-AFTRA announces the termination of the COVID-19 Production Safety and Testing Protocol Agreement, effective May 11, 2023, coinciding with the end of the federal public health emergency. The agreement outlines transitional provisions, including allowing existing mandatory vaccination policies to continue for ongoing productions, permitting performers to request testing for close contact or extreme exertion scenes until July 31, 2023, and requiring producers to seek separate agreement with SAG-AFTRA to retain any previous COVID safety protocols after the termination date.

agreement_title: COVID-19 Production Safety and Testing Protocol Agreement for Corporate-Educational and Non-Broadcast Contracts
agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This temporary agreement between SAG-AFTRA and Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast signatory companies establishes COVID-19 production safety and testing protocols. Effective January 7, 2022, it applies to all individuals on projects covered under the 2019 SAG-AFTRA Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract. The agreement outlines mandatory requirements for pre-employment and ongoing testing, daily health assessments, and temperature checks to mitigate risks during the pandemic.

agreement_info: This waiver allows a producer on a print campaign to compensate only profession performers for b-roll/behind-the-scenes footage. Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This Letter of Adherence binds the undersigned Company (Employer) to the terms and conditions of the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract, as modified, specifically for the production of Behind-the-Scenes footage incidental to a non-covered Print Campaign. The agreement applies only to professional performers engaged for this specific footage production (ONE PRODUCTION ONLY), classifies the footage as a Category II Corporate/Educational project, and includes adherence to the Contract's arbitration, health, and retirement provisions.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This agreement is a Letter of Adherence allowing an employer to use SAG-AFTRA performers for specific "Behind-the-Scenes" footage incidental to Auto Shows or Trade Shows for one production. It incorporates the SAG-AFTRA Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract terms, classifying the footage as Category II (Half-Day Rate) and applying the contract only to performers on this footage, while requiring adherence to health/retirement plans and arbitration.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This document, the 2022 Atlanta Local Corporate-Educational Code, is a specific waiver to the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract, applicable only within the Atlanta Local jurisdiction. It incorporates all terms of the main contract unless expressly modified herein. The primary modifications include permitting a mixed cast of professional and non-professional talent, provided minimum requirements for professional performers are met and they are contracted under SAG-AFTRA. Production under this code is strictly limited to the Atlanta Local.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This document is the 2022 Arizona-Utah Local Corporate/Educational Code, a waiver to the national SAG-AFTRA Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract. Its main purpose is to modify certain terms of the national contract specifically for productions within the Arizona-Utah Local jurisdiction. Key modifications include allowing mixed casts of professional and non-professional talent (with conditions), reducing the rate category structure and rates to 80% of national Category I rates, offering a reduced half-day rate for On-Camera Narrators, and allowing performers to negotiate external supplemental use rights. The agreement is co-terminus with the national contract and strictly limited to the Arizona-Utah Local's geographic scope.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This document, the 2022 Chicago Local Corporate/Educational Code, is a waiver and modification of the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract, specifically approved for use only within the SAG-AFTRA Chicago Local jurisdiction (Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, and Wisconsin). Its main purpose is to adapt the standard contract terms for local productions, allowing for mixed casts of professional and non-professional talent (with only professionals covered), modifying the rate structure based on geographic location within the jurisdiction, and establishing specific rules for usage rights, multiple programs recorded in a day, half-day narrator rates, meal breaks, and live events. Production under this code is strictly limited to the Chicago Local's geographic area.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This document, the "Hawaii Local Corporate/Educational Code," serves as a waiver and modification to the 2022 SAG-AFTRA Corporate/Educational & Non-Broadcast Contract, specifically approved for use within the SAG-AFTRA Hawaii Local jurisdiction. Its main purpose is to apply the terms of the base contract with specific changes tailored for the Hawaii Local, including provisions for mixed professional and non-professional casts, a simplified rate structure (using only Category I rates), discounted rates for performers working on multiple programs in a single day for the same client, and allowing performers to negotiate external supplemental use. The scope is strictly limited to Corporate/Educational productions within the Hawaii Local jurisdiction; producing outside this area under this code is a breach requiring retroactive payment under the full base contract terms.

agreement_info: (Agreement Covering dubbing of foreign language film into English)
summary: This agreement, the SAG-AFTRA Dubbing Agreement, modifies the standard SAG-AFTRA Basic Agreement to specifically govern the employment of performers and singers for dubbing foreign language motion pictures into English. It defines 'dubbing' and 'foreign language motion picture', sets forth compensation rates, overtime rules, and payment terms. The agreement categorizes productions based on their initial and subsequent exhibition markets (Category I for theatrical, network prime time, and large SVOD; Category II for others) and establishes different residual/buyout structures for each category. It also includes provisions regarding vocal stress, digital voice manipulation, script delivery, and the use of personal studios.

agreement_info: Agreement covering dubbing of English language film into Spanish
summary: This agreement between SAG-AFTRA and a Producer establishes the terms and conditions for employing Performers to dub motion picture soundtracks into the Spanish language. It defines the scope of "dubbing" covered, sets compensation rates (hourly, overtime, weekend/holiday), grants exhibition rights for the dubbed content, incorporates and modifies the SAG-AFTRA Basic Agreement, includes provisions for union security, arbitration, term and termination, and requires contributions to pension and health plans.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This agreement, between SAG-AFTRA and Netflix Studios, LLC, modifies the existing Netflix Agreement specifically for the employment of Performers and Professional Singers engaged in dubbing English language soundtracks for foreign language motion pictures. It defines 'dubbing' and 'foreign language motion picture' for the purposes of this agreement, sets forth specific terms for compensation (including hourly rates, overtime, and residuals), pension and health contributions, late payment penalties, and the use of a standard contract. It clarifies that certain provisions of the main Netflix Agreement, such as Preference of Employment, do not apply, while all other provisions remain in effect unless expressly modified herein. The agreement's term runs concurrently with the main Netflix Agreement.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This agreement, the SAG-AFTRA Negotiated Dubbing Employers Agreement, is made between SAG-AFTRA and Dubbing Employers. Its primary purpose is to modify the standard SAG-AFTRA Basic Agreement to establish specific terms and conditions for the employment of performers and singers engaged in dubbing English language soundtracks for foreign language motion pictures. The scope includes defining 'dubbing' (excluding standard looping/ADR), defining 'foreign language motion pictures', outlining compensation rates, overtime, weekend/holiday pay, and establishing two production categories (Category I for theatrical, Network Prime Time TV, or large SVOD; Category II for other markets) with corresponding residual/buyout terms. It also addresses script delivery and vocal stress.

This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) is between SAG-AFTRA and Netflix Studios, LLC. Its main purpose is to modify the existing 2019 SAG-AFTRA-Netflix Agreement and incorporate relevant provisions from the 2020 SAG-AFTRA Codified Basic Agreement and Television Agreement. The scope of the MOA includes specific changes to performer exclusivity and options clauses, such as increasing money breaks for exclusivity, expanding the number of permitted guest star appearances and second position roles, outlining conditions for these outside engagements, and introducing provisions for 'Conflict-Free Windows' during hiatus periods to allow performers more flexibility to accept other work, subject to certain restrictions and notification requirements.

This agreement, the 2024 Tiered-Budget Independent Interactive Media Agreement, is between SAG-AFTRA and an Employer for a specific interactive media project (like a video game) with a total production budget under $30 million. Its main purpose is to provide modified terms, including lower minimum session fees and different secondary compensation structures, for performers based on four defined budget tiers. It applies only to the listed project, requires the project to meet specific criteria from the main SAG-AFTRA Independent Interactive Media Agreement (I-IMA), and mandates adherence to the I-IMA's terms except where explicitly modified herein, including performer payments and benefit contributions.

This 2024 SAG-AFTRA Independent Interactive Localization Agreement is a one-production-only agreement between an Employer and SAG-AFTRA for specific interactive/video game projects that qualify as localization projects (originally scripted in a non-English language with a non-US IP owner). It incorporates most terms of the 2024 SAG-AFTRA Independent Interactive Media Agreement (I-IMA) but modifies certain sections, including performer compensation rates which include a buyout for future use and reuse. The agreement outlines eligibility criteria, responsibilities for payments and contributions, rules for stressful/hazardous sessions, requirements regarding AI/Digital Replicas and performer information protection, and consequences for misrepresentation of project eligibility.

This Interim Interactive Media Agreement is between SAG-AFTRA and a specific Producer, intended to govern the employment of performers on a single, named Interactive Program during and after the current strike, modifying the terms of the expired SAG-AFTRA Interactive Media Agreement (IMA). The scope is limited to the specified program and does not cover future expansions or content. Key modifications include immediate and future increases to wage rates, adjustments to additional compensation and overtime rules, and new provisions regarding Artificial Intelligence and Digital Modeling, requiring performer consent and compensation for the creation and use of digital replicas. SAG-AFTRA retains the right to rescind the agreement for misrepresentation or material non-compliance by the Producer.

This document, the 2011-2014 AFTRA Interactive Media Agreement, is a collective bargaining agreement between the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA) and an Employer. Its main purpose is to recognize AFTRA as the exclusive bargaining agent for Performers engaged in the production of material for Interactive Media throughout the United States. The scope of the agreement covers services for interactive content, including Cloud Gaming, recorded using video tape or other non-film methods, and explicitly excludes traditional linear media like television, film, and radio.

agreement_title: 2017 Interactive Media Memorandum of Agreement (2017 updates)
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement establishes the 2017-2020 SAG-AFTRA Interactive Media Agreement, modifying the previous 2011-2014 AFTRA agreement. It unifies prior agreements, sets a three-year term (2017-2020), and outlines terms for performers in interactive media, including annual wage increases, health and retirement contributions, performer and employer duties, a limited integration clause for franchise use, and transparency requirements for role descriptions. The scope covers performers engaged by signatory companies for interactive media production, excluding specific low-budget and strike-related contracts.

agreement_title: 2020 Interactive Media Memorandum of Agreement (2020 updates)
summary: This Extension Agreement is between SAG-AFTRA and specific companies listed in Schedule A. Its main purpose is to extend the 2017-2020 SAG-AFTRA Interactive Media Agreement for a term of two years, from November 8, 2020, to November 7, 2022. The agreement also modifies certain terms of the previous agreement, specifically increasing minimum wage rates by 3% compounded annually and increasing health and retirement contributions to 16.5%. All other terms of the 2017 IMA remain in full force and effect.

This Interactive Localization Agreement (ILA) is between SAG-AFTRA and an Employer, specifically for the localization (dubbing into English) of a foreign-language interactive or video game program. It incorporates and modifies the SAG-AFTRA Interactive Media Agreement (IMA) and the AMPTP COVID-19 Return to Work Agreement. The agreement outlines eligibility criteria for programs (originally foreign language, localized to finished visual product requiring lip sync, non-US IP owner), modifies performer compensation by introducing a one-time Session Fee that covers future use (excluding merchandising), defines terms for Atmospheric Voices and Vocally Stressful Sessions, and details requirements for taxes, benefits contributions, and workplace safety protocols. The main purpose is to provide specific terms for employing SAG-AFTRA Performers for this particular type of localization work.

This Interim Interactive Localization Agreement (ILA) is between SAG-AFTRA and an Employer, specifically covering the employment of Performers for dubbing or localizing interactive or video game programs originally produced in a language other than English into English. It incorporates terms from the SAG-AFTRA Interim Interactive Media Agreement (Interim IMA) but modifies them for localization work, including specific program qualification criteria, a modified compensation structure (Session Fee including future use/DLC/reuse, but excluding manipulation or merchandising), provisions for vocally stressful sessions, transparency requirements for role descriptions, and transfer of rights clauses. The Employer agrees to abide by the terms, pay wages, benefits, taxes, and contributions, and is bound by the Trust Agreements. The agreement includes a sunset clause, expiring on November 13, 2022.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This document is the 2017 Music Video Supplement to the SAG-AFTRA National Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings Memorandum of Agreement. It modifies the terms of the 2012 agreement between major record labels (Warner Brothers, Atlantic, Sony, UMG, Capitol, Hollywood) and SAG-AFTRA regarding performers in music videos. Key changes include revised definitions for Principal Performer and Background Actor, updated H&R contributions, the introduction of production budget contract tiers affecting performer rates (especially dancers), coverage scope, and new use payments, specific coverage for a limited number of background actors, increased premiums for extraordinary risk, provisions for overnight travel, and terms for digital exploitation payments. It also clarifies coverage for performance capture work and sets the agreement term through April 30, 2019.

agreement_info: This is the master agreement for producers of music videos, detailing their responsibilities and acting as a standalone agreement for non-signatory companies.
summary: This agreement, the SAG-AFTRA 2012 Music Video Agreement, is between SAG-AFTRA and a Company, establishing the terms and conditions for performers employed in the production of music videos. SAG-AFTRA is recognized as the exclusive bargaining agent for various performers (excluding instrumental musicians, extras, etc.). The agreement applies to music videos produced in the United States and its territories, defining 'Music Video' and excluding informal recordings. Key provisions cover union security, preference of employment for qualified professionals (with exceptions), contributions to the AFTRA Health and Retirement Funds, member reporting requirements, and access for SAG-AFTRA representatives to production premises.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) updates and extends the SAG-AFTRA National Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings for the period January 1, 2021, through December 31, 2026. The agreement covers key areas including phased increases to minimum wages and health and retirement (H&R) contributions (including contributions on streaming payments), revised reuse fees for specific uses like blanket catalog licenses and video games, provisions for company-created media projects, updated consent requirements for licensing sound recordings in film/TV and commercials, and revised procedures for the transfer of rights in sound recordings, requiring transferees to assume obligations under the Code.

agreement_title: Sound Recordings Code Appendix on Artificial Intelligence
agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This appendix to the SAG-AFTRA Sound Recordings Code establishes rules for the use of Artificial Intelligence in creating sound recordings. Its main purpose is to regulate the use of 'Digital Voice Replicas' (clones of specific artists' voices) and 'Synthetic Voices' (generated, non-identifiable voices) to protect artists. The scope includes defining these terms, requiring clear consent from artists (or their representatives) for the use of their Digital Voice Replicas in covered recordings, outlining compensation for artists involved in creating or whose voices are replicated, and specifying how purely synthetic tracks are treated for reporting and exploitation purposes. It clarifies that traditional digital audio processing technologies are not subject to these new regulations.

agreement_info: Informational / Guide PDF
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) updates and establishes terms for the 2018-2020 SAG-AFTRA National Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings. It defines and sets terms for foreign licensing and associated conversion fees, modifies grievance and arbitration timelines, extends mobile application provisions, and outlines economic terms including wage increases, changes to H&R contributions and rates (especially for audio streams), and rules for conversion fee late payments. The agreement also clarifies definitions for low fee traditional use and sets the term from January 1, 2018, to December 31, 2020.

agreement_info: This is a memorandum of agreement which details additions and/or changes to our master Sound Recordings Agreement.
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between record companies and SAG-AFTRA updates the National Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings for the period of January 1, 2015, through December 31, 2017. It modifies the previous code by implementing annual rate increases, adjusting contributions and caps for the AFTRA Health and Retirement Funds, defining "Receipts," and significantly revising the terms for digital exploitations of covered recordings (Appendix B). The MOA establishes specific payment rates and terms for various digital formats like permanent downloads, streams, and music videos, directing payments to the SAG-AFTRA and Industry Sound Recordings Distribution Fund (SRDF) for non-Royalty Artists, and includes provisions related to identifying artists for reuse payments.

agreement_info: This is an extension of our master Sound Recordings Agreement.
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement between major record companies and AFTRA extends and modifies the 2007-2010 AFTRA National Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings for the period of July 1, 2010, through December 31, 2011. The agreement's main purpose is to update various terms, including increasing AFTRA Health and Retirement contributions for both non-royalty and royalty artists, revising digital payment terms and schedules to the AFM/AFTRA Fund, amending union security and waiver provisions, redefining a 'side' for payment purposes, and establishing a joint AFTRA/Recording Industry Committee (ARIC) to discuss contract administration and industry relations. It also notes that negotiations regarding music videos will resume.

agreement_title: 2012 Music Video Supplement to Sound Recordings Code
agreement_info: This is the supplement Music Video Agreement for signatories of the full Sound Recordings Code.
summary: This document, the 2012 Music Video Supplement, is an agreement between SAG-AFTRA and signatory Record Labels. It supplements the AFTRA Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings and establishes the terms and conditions for the production of music videos in the United States. The agreement covers various performers (actors, singers, dancers, etc.) employed in music video production, recognizing SAG-AFTRA as their exclusive bargaining agent. Key aspects include the definition of a music video, union security provisions, preference of employment for professional performers, requirements for contributions to the AFTRA Health and Retirement Funds, member reporting obligations, and union access to production premises.

agreement_info: This is a memorandum of agreement which details additions and/or changes to our master Sound Recordings Agreement.
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between major record companies and AFTRA updates the 2007-2010 AFTRA Sound Recordings Code for the period of January 1, 2012, through December 31, 2014. Its main purpose is to modify the existing code by increasing minimum rates and AFTRA Health and Retirement contributions, and establishing detailed terms and payment structures for the digital exploitation of covered sound recordings and music videos (downloads, video streams). The scope also includes new provisions for the reuse and licensing of covered masters in various media, outlining conversion payments and contributions for performers.

agreement_info: This is a memorandum of agreement which details additions and/or changes to our master Sound Recordings Agreement.
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between major record companies and AFTRA modifies and extends the 2002-2006 AFTRA National Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings for the period of July 1, 2007, through June 30, 2010. The agreement updates terms and conditions for AFTRA-covered artists and contractors working on sound recordings, including increases to minimum rates, adjustments to health and retirement contributions and caps, specific provisions for digital exploitation (downloads and streaming), clarification on music video rights, and the introduction of a new process requiring assumption agreements when transferring rights in sound recordings produced under the code.

agreement_info: This is an extension of our master Sound Recordings Agreement.
summary: This Memorandum of Agreement and Extension Agreement extends the 2002-2006 AFTRA National Code of Fair Practice for Sound Recordings between various record companies and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA) for a term from July 1, 2006, through June 30, 2007.
